text: My absolute favorite. Service has always been personable and excellent. Food is fantastic. We have been coming here for a while now. Sometimes alone or even with the kids. They love it too. Reasonably priced for great quality flavors. Must go.
I have been here a couple times with my mom. They recently changed the name to Red Lantern. I ordered the Beef Chow Fun. It has become my favorite, it is always great.

We had the appetizer sampler and chicken noodle soup. The pho was classically delicious, really helped soothe my cold. I wouldnt miss out on the sampler.. Gives you a nice taste of what they have going on and its full flavor. Would definitely order again. Our server had a nice smile and the team worked well together.
Clean, comfortable, Excellent food and great service! Employees are welcoming and have great personalities def makes for a more enjoyable experience.

When my husband and I pulled up to this place, I realized we've been here before. It was a different name back then and the food was bad. The pork for their broken rice was too salty and the pho was just so so. That's why we never came back. I was a little scared about trying this place again even though it's a different name now. Possibly under new management? We weren't sure but decided to give it a try still since we were meeting family here. The minute we walked in, we were greeted by two super friendly staff. They took our order right away and the food came fast. My husband and I ordered pho, spring rolls and egg rolls. My sister and brother-in-law ordered pho and b√∫n. I was thoroughly impressed with how flavorful and tasty everything was. Also, nothing was overly salty. The service was top notch. The owner kept coming back to refill our water and also stopped to chat with us. I am glad I gave this place a try. I will definitely be back.

I noticed that they changed their name from Annie Pho 2, but they have the same manager and employees. That's good for me because it means that their food hasn't changed, just the name. This has been our go-to neighborhood place for pho. We've been going here since it was Annie Pho 2. 

Their food and service has always been consistently excellent. The pho broth is flavorful and they don't skimp on the items in the soup. You get plenty of noodles, meat, etc. in each bowl. I highly recommend the fresh spring rolls and butter fried chicken wings as appetizers. We've even ordered those items for parties and they've been big hits. In addition to their pho, I've tried their pork chop rice dish. Huge servings with two large pork chops and a fried egg over easy served on top to mix with your rice and pork chops. Like I said earlier, the rice and noodle dish servings are large and they don't skimp. They also serve desserts and Thai ice tea. 

If you're in the mood for great pho (or other Vietnamese dishes) served fast and with friendly service in a very clean environment, I highly recommend Red Lantern (formerly Annie Pho 2).

We love coming here! My husband and I have become regulars, they know us by name.  The staff are super friendly and they go out of their way to make us vegan meals! We love our tofu fried rice and veggie soup.  

The service is top notch!
I called and asked if they were the old Pho Annie 2, he asked if I wanted take out, I replied "No" and they hung up on me....maybe they get that question a lot, but it's still a legit question.

This place is unique in that the owner and staff are American. That's what sets this place apart:  No language barrier! No "Vietnamese service". Eric is amazing.

But that wouldn't matter at all if the food weren't good. The food is fantastic! I have been to most of the notable pho places in Vegas, and there are some really good pho places here, and let's be honest: the pho here is on par with the best of them. Yes, you can get better, maybe at Pho 88, for example, but hardly anywhere else.

And there are things that make Red Lantern special. That's what I look for, when adding a place to the pho rotation: something I can't get anywhere else. Here, you can get proper vegetarian pho, in case that one annoying friend is with you; vegetable pho made with vegetable broth that is actually really good, and unlike other places, the vegetarian options are clearly marked on the menu. I get the vegetable pho sometimes myself, and I'm not a vegetarian.

Here, you can get pho ga, chicken pho, with actual chicken broth. You'll have to ask for the chicken broth, but it is sooooo good. Most places don't do chicken broth, but here, it's available. And if you want the BBQ pork pho, you can get it with, believe it or not, pork broth! That's not something you can find most places! (It's a pork broth with a little chicken in it, what they use in the mi vit quay, the duck soup, and it is yummy.)

I got the shrimp spring rolls one time and they were great. They are served with lettuce sticking out the top, which doesn't affect the taste, but the presentation is great.

Also try the duck, the mi vit quay; it's not quite as good as you get at Pho 88 but it is so good you will make little noises while eating it. The beaf stew is great also.

Service is better than any other pho place in town, no comparison. No "Vietnamese service" here. Eric and Rich will take care of you. If you're used to the service at normal pho places this will be a revelation. You won't have to wait for your check, or to have your drink refilled. (Yes, refillable drinks, not brought in a can.)

The owner is clearly proud of what he's created here, and for good reason. Red Lantern is one of the best pho places in Vegas, a town that has a lot of really good pho.
First of all, the pho is good! Second and very important the service is fast, friendly, and accurate. We came in as a family of 5 twice and the second time we walked in they recognized us right away!

Literally love this place. Best pho in Summerlin area (and the rest of Vegas really) by far!! I've tried several places in Henderson, as well as other places in Summerlin, and nothing compares. Also they're really great about food allergies and the owner will speak with you directly (fluent English) in person or over the phone, to go over menu items you can and can't have. I have a gluten allergy and have had lots of problems with this in the past. I'm happy to report the pho is gluten free and guilt free to the wallet!!
Very very good , the tendon it's very good come back again fast service and good food

Definitely the best Pho restaurant we found in Las Vegas. We've been eating at Pho restaurants for 15 years in many different countries so we are pretty picky about our Pho. Service was excellent and the food was delish

I usually hate going to the same place a million times but I find myself here almost every week (and sometimes twice if it's been a really bad week). The service is great, the prices are very reasonable, and the food is consistently delicious. I'm here so much, we've gotten our order down to an exact science. Everything I've tried has been yummy but I do always make sure to get the rare steak pho. No matter what else gets added to the order, that pho is there. The owners are really chill and friendly and I really love coming here!

Name changed only and still the same owner and serving tasty pho as always.  Family atmosphere and the owner always stops by to chat.  My go to place for pho whenever I am on the SW side of the valley.

I was referred by my friend, and we try the vemercilii/Eggroll/grill beef   was good but the Fish sauce was little salty , and we want to try it again and this time we try the  PHO , it was good the price is OK not much of noodle or beef .
Very clean ,  Service is very nice and friendly !!!

I live in summerlin. I live very close to here. They have great service, it is clean, and has excellent food. The owners work hard, and treat me like family.  They are very welcoming. I highly recommend this resturant.

Wow  thats all i can say with over all experience here at red lantern! Clean place, good food, friendly and excellent people works here! I was with my kids and they were very nice for my 3 year old daughters needs, from the drink straw that they made for her, the bowl that she will use for her pho. Everything here is amazing! Check this place out and you wont regret it! Thumbs up!
Our new go to for Pho! I always order the chicken and my husband will get the rare beef. We both love it. And the service is always top notch which we appreciate!!!

Ihave no clue how this place has so many great reviews...the food was absolutely horrible. We went here just because of the reviews. Very bad experience. Went to another one on South Rainbow and there is no comparison..yucky

The BFF and I absolutely love this place! The best service. The best pho. Freshest spring rolls by far! We usually come several times a week and the food is consistently delicious each time. We also tried their garlic chicken wings once and they were ahhhhh-mazing! 

I think the only thing that disappoints us is that they are closed on Tuesdays but its not the end of the world for us. 

We will forever be a regular at this spot.

This review is based solely on pricing. I order takeout here many times since I found it. All times I have ordered the B1 which is a rice noodle bowl with pork and egg rolls. Every time I've asked them to substitute the pork with beef instead and it has been no problem. I ordered exactly the same and this time the guy charged me the lemon grass bowl and added a $3 charge for egg rolls. Makes no sense. Not a big deal, I'll pay it but that's just not cool when plenty times it was substituted for the pork for the normal price not an up charge. Won't be ordering here again.
The food is fresh and the service is excellent. They have a pretty good vegetarian selection with several options. And you can't go wrong with a fresh sliced coconut to drink!

Amazing pho! Great service! In a good neighborhood. 
All of the staff are amazing and attentive. Always friendly!
Came here for duck noodle soup,  I'd give it a 4/5 .. Good portion of duck and broth was tasty.. will be back to try the pho!! Servers were nice,  restaurant was clean and it's in the neighborhood!!

This place used to be Annie Pho 2 but it recently changed their name.  I have been going here for a year and the food is delicious!   Its super clean and the servers are great.  They are very attentive and your water glass is always filled.  This Vietnamese restaurant is top notch.  This is a must place to go to!! Its off the 215 and Russel.  Forget the places in Chinatown or anywhere else. There's so many Asian places that are disgusting when you walk in.  Make the drive here and you will not be disappointed !

I love this spot. Close to work, and a boba place. How can you go wrong? Their Pho is so delicious and what I've eaten from the rest of the menu has been awesome as well. 

The employees and owner are very friendly and always welcoming. The food comes out super fast and hot. What more could you want?

Favorites:
spring rolls
Veggie pho (w/ beef broth)
Chicken curry soup

I always order the veggie pho. It comes with tofu, and what one would think is an entire garden of vegetables. I tend to love spice, so I always order an extra side of jalape√±os so I don't have to share with friends. 

The chicken curry soup is so yummy but super filling, I like it's lighter cousin, pho. The chicken is tender, but it does come on the bone so be prepared to work for it a bit. 

Seriously love this place. And with so many pho spots to choose from, that's saying something.
As mentioned before it was pho annie now red lantern, same people, same food. The broth is on the sweet side, which is unique and not my favorite. But the quality of food is good.

Clean, fast and delicious! The three guys who I've seen working here are attentive and polite, they are aware a majority of the people coming in are on their lunch break and don't have the time to linger, you can feel the service is thusly efficient but not rushed; that's a good balance. The food is very good and the menu has been scaled down and much simpler to order from. I came once when it was called Pho Annie 2 and the menu was like a giant flip book. I remember Co workers told me they didn't like it here because it was slow and closed at random times, but I didn't let that stop me from trying again after the name change. Now I've visited several times and enjoyed every new item I've ordered. I went back and told my co workers how much it's changed and some have returned as regulars. 
My highlight however, and I'm still impressed...they had Bun Bo Hue WITH the cubes... If you've had it before you'll know what I mean. In addition, the guy who assisted me (with glasses) pronounced the name perfectly.
Such amazing broth! I haven't been able to find a really good Pho place since I left San Diego, but this place totally kills it! The staff is so friendly and the food is epic!

Why I enjoyed this place? The answer is simple---they have delicious Vegetarian Pho (Vegetarian Broth) 

I've been to many Pho Restaurants but as the time goes by they can't keep up with their consistency especially when they are busy.

Ate here three times already and so far they've been consistent with their presentation, taste, customer service and cleanliness. 

My husband enjoyed his rare steak and meatballs pho and he said the broth was really  good. We don't know how an authentic Pho taste, so this recommendation is based upon two individuals who likes to eat :o)

My wife and I have been back multiple times since our first encounter with this place. Our first time was quite the experience because we ordered pho and we still had a craving for the delicious food so we went back up and ordered some fried rice and everything came out quick! What we enjoyed about this place were the dudes running the front, they are super casual and easy to work with, idk if they are owners of the joint but we give it 5.0 stars every time.

We like coming here, there is a family atmosphere.
My husband orders Asian beef stew noodle soup, he thinks its awesome. I usually get the chicken curry or just the shrimp and beef roll, our son gets the kid size beef noodle soup. Prices are great and we all enjoy the taste as well.
They use to be called Pho Annie 2 but their new name, Red Lantern is better.. great job to everyone that works there!

I'm really loving this place now... the combo pho is really really good.  I order at least once a week... sometimes twice a week.  The staff is friendly and quick for pick-up.  They are closed Tuesdays though.  Great location, great food, love me some pho!

Three of us came here to check it out on our lunch break because of the high yelp ratings. We didn't like the papaya salad ( too sweet and no flavor) and all of us decided the food was pretty average. The presentation was good and the service was attentive wish we could give a higher rating but the food was just ok.

I can see why people like the pho here.   But personally, it's just not the flavor I like.   It was more of the sweeter broth, which sorry, it's just not my jam.  On the plus side, the rare steak was super good.  The flank was very fatty to me but some people love the fat.  The noodles were good too.  Portions were on par with the other places in town.  

Nice staff, clean establishment, and quality service.   I'm not about that sweet broth life and the broth is the main part of pho.  

But if you are a sweet broth person, you will definitely enjoy this place.

Excellent service and great quality food. Eric and his staff are amazingly friendly and provide great customer service. They have worked hard to develop a menu that appeals to all types - vegetarian options included. An excellent option for pho and other Vietnamese dishes.

Absolutely amazing food. I visited Friday and have since returned 3 days in a row.
My goal is to order something different each time. I can tell the chefs put their heart and soul into their cooking; my new favorite place to eat in Vegas!!!

I absolutely love this place [Red Lantern (formerly Pho Annie 2)]. The owner and staff are prompt with service and the food comes out spectacularly and at a good pace. The atmosphere is definitely casual and quaint. Pricing is fine and comes with the comforting tastes in a comforting place! A place to frequent often.

It's good.
I saw they had FREE Thai tea in the tips and comments in Yelp and when I went they charged it $3. It was good but free is better. 
No people when I went but bowls are good and portions are too. Most soups range 7-9 dlls.
Close to my home. All the food was great. The restaurant is clean and has a cool vibe. I will definitely eat there again.

We were pho lovers, hungry and after long trip we took the chance to try out Pho at the Red Lantern. Very happy with super clean and attentative service. Go try the clear beef broth here to appreciate the pleasant high quality pho. Clear broth in pho means the chef must remove the fat and particles as they boil off and float on top of the pot, if not removed they release unpleasant taste to your soup.

We return the next day and confirm the same great pho there.
Wonderful Pho and extremely well priced. We are there so often my waiter knows what we like so we don't even need a menu.

Wow!! I love trying hidden hole in the wall places like this because you can find the best authentic food at amazing prices. 

First off right away the cleanliness, fast service and friendliness of the staff deserve 5 stars alone. It makes any experience better when youre comfortable and helped by fast and cheerful staff. 

The menu offers veggie options for each category with a wide menu to choose from overall. Our order today started with Chai tea and veggie pot stickers. Wow! I could have stopped right there and been so happy. The chai is delicious and the veggie pot stickers are PHENOMENAL. Crunchy, savory, warm and and hint of sweet they are perfect.

Our pho arrived fast and accurately. I ordered veggie broth pho and my boyfriend got a house beef pho. As soon as the bowls came down we dug in and it was glorious. Everything was fresh hot and made to order. All this amazing food to make your mouth water for the cheapest prices!

Absolutely reccomend this spot as a must try if you love pho.

5 stars for service alone. My family and I have visited this place probably 3-4 times in the past month and a half. 

Love their pho & vegetarian options. Portions are good- everyone I've visited with loved their meals. 

The waiters are very friendly and attentive. I hope they never lose their staff.

I was home sick so I tried Red Lantern Pho for takeout and it was tasty. The pricing seemed reasonable and the service was good. I think I'll give it another try and go in to try some other stuff we ordered the spring rolls & Seafood soup too.

Solid Vietnamese restaurant! Really great flavorful pho and everything else we ordered was amazing as well.

Both the servers were funny, quick, and attentive. 

I didn't get the pho this time around but after tasting my husband's.. I'll definitely be ordering it. 

My daughter really liked the fried dumplings as well!

First let me say that the customer service here is remarkable. I always feel so welcomed when greeted at the door, which is usually by Eric. Thank you Sir! 

Red lantern is an exemplary place to enjoy Pho and Vietnamese style food. My first time ordering there I was able to selected the items that I wanted in my Pho, which is rare. Most places don't like straying from their own creations. Let me tell you...If you're looking for perfectly ROASTED DUCK this is the place to get it! I ordered the roast duck with rice as I have several times at different restaurants but this place beats them all by a long shot. No soggy, fatty skin here. It's perfectly roasted with crispy skin as it should be and the flavor is amazing! no bland food here. I also recommend the Kalbi short ribs and the "Shaking Beef". I could go on and on but this should suffice. I found a gem
Excellent customer service! Food is great and best Pho in town. Grilled pork chops are amazing as well.

This neighborhood Vietnamese restaurant has a lot going for it. Service team is always on point and really invested In The guest experience, while amenities are humble so are the prices so value proposition is correct. Very clean facility and strong management provide a consistent and fast experience. Food highlights are the garlic chicken wings, pork chop and I really like the chilled noodles. Flavor profiles are decidedly sweet and leaning towards the American palette but that suits the neighborhood, personally I wouldn't mind a little more funk and spice but I can certainly appreciate what it is they have going on.

Tables were very clean. Service was quick. Food was ready very fast. Got a rare steak and meatball pho. Meatballs were overdone but the steak was good. Noodles were thin, but good. Sprouts were slightly bitter. Broth was on the sweeter side. The steamed potstickers are very very good. Closest place to my house, so I'll probably be back at some point...but this place is far from the best.
Great pho broth.  It was light and seasoned just right.  Their spring rolls are fresh and delicious too.  Best Pho in the SW!

Great food and great service.   It was known as soon as we walked in the door that the service would be great and have a family feel.  The place was very clean!  The food was so good that we ordered some to go for later.   After we had left, we had car trouble.  They offered us a ride to autozone and brought out their tool box.  Can't get a better experience than that.  We found our Pho spot!

I love everything about this place! The pot stickers and crab Rangoon are THE BEST, perfectly crispy and substantial amount of filling. I used to be obsessed with the chicken curry pho, but now I don't eat chicken or beef so I just get the beef broth pho with no added meat. The broth has so much flavor and I'm perfectly content with the amount of noodles, scallion, jalape√±o, lime and bean sprouts. The staff are always super friendly and helpful! They're busy every single time I'm there, which is great! I usually get my order to take home and it stays hot and fresh.

I walked in the door and he looked annoyed at my presence. He told me to sit anywhere then as he walked by he put a menu on my table without speaking or looking at me. He came back and asked if I'd decided in an "you're wasting my time" tone. No smile or engagement. I asked him about an item and he practically rolled his eyes. He left without asking me if I wanted anything to drink so I has to ask his back for a Thai tea. 
After that I saw him engage with a couple, smile, dote on them but for most people he seemed  uninterested. Apparently his name is Richard. He introduced himself to the couple so that's the only reason I know that.
First came the Thai tea. Super yummy but served in a to-go cup for some reason.
My spring rolls came out next. I ordered grilled pork, I got ham. Back they went to the kitchen.
Next up came my Red Lantern pho. It was actually very good, even better with the jalapenos. The only problem here is that I ordered it without tripe, and, you'll never guess, it had tripe! I took that out and enjoyed pretty much the whole bowl.
Lastly my new spring rolls came out but I was too full to eat them so I actually have no idea how they taste. I'm sure I'll find out during Friday night Netflix and nosh later.
I was ready to give this place 1 or 2 stars for the food alone, but then another server, much nicer than the first, apologized for the multiple errors and actually bothered to try to make amends. He, and he alone, made me boost my score to three stars. Thank you sir.
These guys are great! They are very polite and always attentive. You can't find better service anywhere. Plus, my kids crave their Pho, so it's gotta be good. Glad they are so close to home!

This place has amazing customer service, the BEST Thai tea. Their pho is pretty good but super fatty. I got brisket, rare steak (amazing taste), and flank... I believe it was the flank that was mostly fat. I'd come back to try other things on their menu and still for their delicious pho. Bow, their customer service... amazing. The waiter was sweet and interacted with my son giving him a high five. Then, I'm assuming the owner.. an older white male.. brought the check. It was just myself and my son. He hands my son the check to pay which tickled my kid like no other. I gave my son my card and let him pay. He brings back the card with the recipe and again hands it to my son to sign and finish paying. I've never had someone so interactive with my son which I absolutely loved. Again, I will come back because of how amazing and personal they are and I'm sure everything else they have is delicious.

This place never disappoints! My boyfriend and I have eaten here multiple times, even back when it was Pho Annie 2. Thank god all that changed was the name! The food and service is still just as amazing! Any of the pho is an absolute must, but the pad thai is always a good pick.

I didn't know that we have nice Pho restaurant in my area. I always drive all the way to China Town. I tired Red Lantern and it was delicious!! Service was also great and different people came to check on me. I had Spring Roll and Pho and both are amazingly good. I am not huge fan of getting my check when I'm not even half way to finish my meal but that was about it if I have something negative to say. Bathroom was also clean and I will definitely go back there and bring more friends over!
Great Vietnamese spot, happy to see the same owners and the previous joint, super nice staff. The food is great for take out or dine in!

I love this place! I never like pho til going here! It's so clean the place! I love that the chicken is more chunkier pieces not so dry and thin cut! I will only go there for pho when I'm craving! I can't wait to try other items off their menu!
Amazing pho!!! Very fresh and great meat quality! Which is not usually common in pho places. The costumer service was great as well and very clean place!!

Been eating here almost weekly for 6 months or so.  Best Pho I've ever had and we had some really good places in DC.  And the garlic chicken wings are out of this world!

Was getting anxious while they remodeled from Pho Annie 2 to the Red Lantern but the food and great service have stayed the same.

I've had multiple dishes from this restaurant, and they've all been tasty. They're very very good. I'm giving them five stars cuz four stars pretty low. It's good food, low prices, good service, and super close to where I live/work. It's not a five-star YOU HAVE TO EAT HERE. It's a personal five star...

Buuuut if you're a foodie and you're into trying "new" things, I highly recommend the curry chicken soup/pho. It's more on the savory/spicy side with a hint of coconut. I like my curries savory/spicy and avoid the sweeter ones so this absolutely did it for me. It has a generous portion of bone-in chicken in it. If you're less adventurous and more of a picky eater, you might ask for something boneless, but I feel like the bone-in is more flavorful than other chicken pho I've had, but this might have more to do with the curry than the presence of the bone in the broth. 

So if you've been eyeing this place for a while and been curious about this chicken curry pho, go for it. Besides the chicken curry, I've had the garlic chicken wings (good, but I wouldn't specifically come here for it - Big Wong's has spoiled me), pho of all kinds (good if you're in the area and in the mood), the Com Bo Luc Lac C7 (this is a solid 4 out of 5 stars and I prefer it to the short ribs which I've also had).

A very clean restaurant that's out and away from Chinatown but well worth the drive. The menu offers a good variety of items with some dishes not typical Vietnamese fare. Adequate portions and reasonable prices. The server was friendly and fast, and I loved the broth's light flavor (a small side of beef broth soup came with my kalbi meal)!  A mixed sampler can also be made to order which I requested because I really wanted to taste just a few pieces each of my favorite appetizers. I didn't think the food was totally Asian authentic, but for me, it didn't need to be because it was all still delicious!  I'll certainly come back for more! :D
Just dropped in with the family.  Was very  surprised how good thr food was. The service was fantastic as well. Highly recommended!!
Good customer service but pho and food are mediocre. The bun ruie is too salty. The pho not flavorful.

Vegan pho for the win! I love this pho place!! It's located in a quiet shopping center off the 215 south. Parking is simple and the place is never too crazy mid day when we usually go. They don't serve alcohol, beer, or wine. However, everything is fresh and made in house which is something I can really appreciate. 

The vegan veggie pho is out of this world. They load it up full of veggies and the broth is amazing. By far my favorite vegan pho in town. The kids love the fried rice and shrimp tempura. The shrimp tempura is made fresh in house and cooked to golden perfection for them. They love it. My boyfriend orders the rare steak pho and he says it's the best yet. They load it up with meat and he always orders extra noodles. All the fixins and sauces come on the table already so you never have to wait. I highly recommend stopping in and giving it a try the next time you're craving pho.
I'm so happy to learn that it is still the same owner!! Food here is delicious and the service is excellent!! I'm so happy to have a Pho restaurant close to my home!!
Delicious food, places is very neat and proper. They also have excellent food service's. Definitely recommended to my relatives and friends.

Of all the Vietnamese pho restaurants, this is my favorite and here is why. There is one thing lacking in most Vietnamese/Asian restaurants: presentation. There is almost zero effort in making the food look presentable. But the rice plates here not only looks appetizing but also taste delicious. Got the pork chop plate and it's the best plate I ever had. This place sets the new standard for all Vietnamese pho restaurants in the valley.

If you're looking for a Pho spot in Vegas this is the one. I come here almost weekly with my wife. I normally get the rare beef. The quality of the beef is very good and tender also there's more meat in a bowl than I've seen from other spots. The broth is clean and tasty.

We ventured out of the pho realm and got their kalbi beef and wow, its cooked to how I remember it should be when I lived in Hawaii and the marinade is delicious. 

Same management. They are super friendly and remember our names!

Love this place! My husband and I go here and order take out from here faithfully. The owner is so nice and keeps this place spotless! I always hesitate eating out because you never know what happens in the kitchens but you can tell he takes pride in his business. My go to is the chicken pho and spring rolls! So yummy and big portions. My husband usually just gets chicken fried rice and he loves it. Once again it has a very big portion.

We've been coming here (when it was Pho Annie) for a while. I love that they added more vegetarian options to the menu, and a kids meal (although my son is stuck on ordering rice and tofu). Excellent place, Eric the owner is awesome. My favorite pho in town.

This new pho restaurant is awesome.  The environment is inviting and clean. I got the bbq pork with vermicelli and it was FLAVORFUL.  My wife got the Bun Bo Hue and she was impressed with the authenticity of how it tasted. We are both Vietnamese and highly critical of our pho restaurants. We definitely  recommend Pho Annie 2 if you have the urge for Vietnamese food.

The takeout was quick and easy.  Price was $8-11 for a typical pho.  I had the Red Lantern special to go and had it ready to go in 10 minutes.  The broth was good, but I didn't expect the meat to be literally uncooked upon arrival.  I guess cooking it in the broth as a sort of hot pot was their method for pickups, but I felt like I was still eating raw meat after letting it sit.  In all, it is Pho, but I think there's tastier options nearby.

"Pho"-nominal" food!!!! I was across town for appointments today. My stomach started growling and I knew I needed something to go and take home. I got on Yelp and found this very cool little place next to my veterinarian's office.

I've seen it before, I just didn't know what I was missing until today... Man is this place awesome!!! It ain't much to look at from the outside but the inside is very clean and cute.  They have KILLER fresh Pho and Vietnamese meals and are open for lunch and dinner. FYI they are closed every Tuesday (random).

My husband absolutely loves any type of Asian Cuisine. I personally find most of it to be greasy but I have found that Vietnamese cooking and pho is pretty good and if made properly not too greasy.

I didn't know what to expect so I got my bravery badge out and decided to look at what the yelpers were saying and order based on what they recommended. Best decision ever!

I brought it home... My husband and I tore into it like two hungry Truckers... We moaned and slurped everything up in about 20 minutes. I should have slowed down and enjoyed more but I could not help it it was so good. He told me it's his new fav... I'm so glad I stopped and will definitely be back!

The food at this place is delicious! I had their pho and usually judge a place by its broth... it was definitely quality. Also, had their spring rolls and my mother ordered their combination egg and shrimp. and she loved it. Lots of parking and the venue is cool and clean. We will definitely be returning! I would recommend this place

The staff was very friendly and the food was good. As a vegetarian I thought there were many choices to choose from. I ordered the vegetarian pot stickers and the vegetarian pho. The one thing that would have made my review 5 stars would be if there was more tofu & mushrooms in the pho. Overall I enjoyed the food and I will definitely come back.

i was not expecting a lot when i came here, we ordered the mixed pho and asian beef stew and we were very satisfied!!! great food, with  even better service. it's just not in a convinient location but i wouldn't mind driving here again.

It's 108 degrees outside but I don't mind having their ohh sooo good authentic pho. Delicious food, friendly service and reasonable price. I almost forgot to complement their freshly brewed thai tea..sooo good

Excellent pho first and foremost with customer service to match. I thought it was a new place but they have been here for two years! Much better than any other place ive been to. Will be back! My fav is the veggie pho with the beef broth. Veggies are fresh and clean and broth full of flavor.

I never thought I liked Pho until one day when I woke up after a long night of drinking and felt like I absolutely had to have some sort of savory soup in my belly to feel better. Red Lantern is really close to my house and already had good reviews so we decided to check it out. I got a vegetarian pho with spicy beef broth and it is seriously one of my favorite things now. We also now get pot stickers and either egg rolls or crab rangoon and go all out on the calories and fat, because why not? Also, place is clean, friendly and quick service, and very affordable.
Four days after we first went there, my BF picked himself up some dinner when I was out to dinner with the girls and I came home to find multiple take out boxes from - you guessed it - Red Lantern, so - needless to say - we unanimously agree in this household that their food is pretty darn good.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. I grew up eating pho and am a native to Vegas. This is the best I've had here. The wings are amazing as well. I have yet to have anything bad. Also the staff is so nice and personable.
We traveled away from the Strip just to try this place for lunch and so happy we did.  And everyone was so friendly and welcoming. We will definitely go back for lunch next time we're in Vegas!
Really tasty pho,spring rolls, and their grilled pork plate is Bomb! Very quick service and great for takeout. This place is my Vietnamese go to

Never had pho before. This was pretty good. I think I like ramen better, but this place is real close to home and there's a lot of other good stuff on the menu I wanna try. Wife had the chicken curry bowl, it was real tasty. We'll be back.

I have eaten here two times and both meals were very good. I am not versed in this style of cuisine, so even though there may be better stores out there, I found my entr√©e to be fresh, hot and delicious. The store was clean, comfortable and the service was friendly and attentive. I will definitely go out of my way to patronize this location again and again.

Great place to eat up by the Summerlin area. The food is good, service is great, and the atmosphere is calm. Not to mention the best Thai tea I've had in awhile.. Not your traditional Vietnamese pho place, but is a great contender for authentic food! Also a HUGE thumbs up for not having to drive down to Chinatown when I'm in the mood for pho.

Great local pho! Their service is always wonderful. It's comparable to the places in Chinatown and price is definitely better here. Their soup is clean and flavorful. I have eaten in and also done take out with their pho, no difference in quality and quantity. I have a toddler so some days take out is required. When eating in with my toddler they provided me with a small bowl with spoon and fork and also scissors to cut the noodles without me having to ask for it all.

I have been enjoying Pho noodle soul since college in east coast and I found this perfect place in Vegas after trying out several Pho places on Spring Mt road which is too far me.

The place is neat, clean and only 5 minutes away from my home.  The service is great and most of all, the foods are excellent amd delicious. My recommendation is Pho (any types.. I like combination Pho) and Kalbi (Korean style short ribs with rice).  

There is nothing better than having a hot Pho to get over with your hang over.  Try it if you are near.

I can't say enough good things about this place! I think they have the best pho in town. Their quality meat is way better than the poplar ones in town. I always get the brisket and rare steak pho. Also, their service is amazing. The staff here are really friendly and genuinely care about your day. Would definitely recommend coming here!

This is my favorite pho place in the area. I like that it's never super busy, and it's very clean. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating, and they are good with my requests. I've been eating a ketogenic diet (very low carb) for about a month now, and I've been ordering the rare steak and brisket with extra meat, adding veggies, and no noodles. Yes, pho without noodles?? Blasphemy! But I swear to you it is delicious. And I like the broth and meat best anyways. Very tasty food here! My only beef with this place (lol) is that their water tastes like toilet water. I can overlook that for some good pho though, just squeeze a lime in the water and it's passable.

I'm so glad that this restaurant is being ran by a new owner. The service is impeccable and all the staff are so respectful. To say the least, the food is the best. I'm so glad that they are on this side of town. Kudos to all the staff at Red Lantern. Keep up the great food!

We've found our Pho place...we're very happy that they're close by and their food is excellent! Pho and B√∫n Tht Nng is awesome....spring rolls are also great! Service is attentive and courteous! If you're in the SW part of town this is the go to Pho place!

The Pho tastes real good and I love  ordering the Spicy Beef Satay. Delicious and adds some great variety to an already diverse menu. Staff is super friendly and will treat you well. Great spot for the Southwest!

This place is my go to Pho place! 
It's nice that it's tucked away and close to home, but unfortunate that I seem to crave pho every Tuesday when they are closed. 
I always get their chicken pho and the shrimp and pork spring rolls, as well as their chicken pad Thai sometimes. All amazing! 
So amazing, that I never remember to take a photo until I'm almost done!
This place is always amazing!  Soup always comes out hot!!! We just moved into the area and have been here 3 times in the last 4 days!  Service is always so awesome!!! We won't go anywhere else!!
The best Pho place on the southwest side and the staff are very friendly ana personable

We have been here several times. They are very nice and attentive! 

It isn't the best pho you'll have but it's good. It's very chill and you can be in and out quickly if you like. 

I'm a fan of the basics like shrimp spring rolls, Vietnamese egg rolls, and pho tai and they are on par with most others. 

My boys love the shrimp fried rice. It's a generous portion with a good amount of shrimp. And it's got good flavor and lots of egg and veggies mixed in. I do hate that they leave the tails on. This is a pet peeve. Then, I have to dig through the hot, greasy food to remove the tails. Not ideal. 

Good pho quick with nice service!

I have tried several pho places in the area and this is hands down my favorite so far. The owner, his staff keep the place very clean and welcoming. The pho is made fresh and the veggie egg rolls are always top notch.
Absolutely love this place! The food and the staff are amazing and with the new menu, you can now pick from so many good dishes! Thanks guys!
Great pho.  Friendly, accommodating, and clean space in which to enjoy your meal.
Great service, clean and great food at reasonable prices.  I totally agree with other 5-star rating.  I've been a regular customer since August 2017.  My favorites are Seafood Pho and spring rolls.
Great pho. Great prices. Very friendly staff. Nice and quiet place. Glad I tried it out. Definitely coming back!

This is my favorite pho place now in town. I used to go to a different pho place but started getting stomach aches. So now me and hubby are regulars here. 

I love their rare steak and tripe pho. I also love their chicken pho here. Their fresh spring rolls are really good too.
Best pho in Las Vegas! Eric and Richard are awesome! We always have a good time talking and joking around. We usually order chicken pho. The potstickers are also one of our favorites.

Best Pho! I use to come here all the time when I lived down the street. I recently Moved and tried 2 other pho restaurants but they were just not as good. I will drive a lil farther to get pho from Red Lantern!

Previously Pho Annie... Some how with the same owner, Eric who is super duper nice btw, the food managed to get better! 

We were afraid when we saw the signs being taken down that our go to place for Pho had closed. Our hearts were broken for a couple of days!! Lucky for us it was a simple sign change but everything was right where we left it :)

The food is consistent but like I said, the food some how tasted better this time around. I always get spring rolls to share and the rare steak soup. Gah, so good. In the winter we like to have Pho at least once a week, in the summer maybe every two and we always come here, err when it was Pho Annie :)

I loved the presentation of their fresh shrimp spring roll and the broth of the pho was just right. Not too salty. You'll know they have good quality broth because you don't have that dry mouth feeling after eating it

4 bowls of pho ga hit the spot. Soup was very flavorful with plenty of chicken.  Although chicken was very dry.

My one kid had to be different and ordered the pho bo vien, she said she liked it.

Ordered the chicken garlic butter wings perfectly cooked with a nice crunch on the skin and with the garlic butter -- it was game over.

Had the flank beef pho with the garlic butter chicken wings. 

Food 10/10
Service 10/10
Love this place! Staff is amazing and friendly! The food is excellent and every time I try something new, I am pleased with my choice. The BEST fresh spring rolls in town! I would eat here everyday.
Food is delicious! Lemon beef and pork chops were very tender. Customer service was great. They were friendly and the service was fast. I definitely recommend this Vietnamese restaurant.

I absolutely love this place. I've become a regular here at lunch. The staff is super-friendly and attentive. They know me by name and know my usual order. It's got a quaint family atmosphere The food is great. It's THE perfect place for Pho, especially when the weather starts to cool down. 

I recommend the chicken curry soup. It's amazing. I was having lunch one day and a guy at another table had a When Harry Met Sally moment when he tasted it. There was a lot of moaning and groaning goodness. I had instant food envy.

I love this place everything is so good from appetizers to their pho and rice meals! Make sure to order the Vietnamese egg rolls and potstickers for starters. It is cooked to perfection! They use good meats for this pho and broth is rich and flavorful. The shaking beef is also yummy with tender meat and not too salty. Luckily I live close to this place so I can visit this often.

This is our favorite pho spot and it's right in our neighborhood. The staff is friendly and attentive, the service is always quick and the food is amazing. We go here at least once a week and have never been disappointed.

the first time i came i had the grilled shrimp and rice, which was tasty. it came with a cup of the soup broth and an over easy egg! this time i tried the lemon grass chicken breast with rice (which also came with a cup of soup) and it is something i'd definitely order again.
the service was very good! each server was very attentive and the food came out fast a delicious

The food here is very fresh and tasty and the service is wonderful.  This is a great place to come for lunch and the prices are very reasonable.  They also make orders for me to go, never once have I been dissatisfied...

This was my first visit and I tried a lot of stuff!  Had the Thai iced tea and it was good. Presentation was a little different as it was blended, not milk over the tea. Had an order of the fresh shrimp spring roll and the fresh grilled pork spring roll. Both were fresh and excellent. Can easily tell when they're made in advance cause the paper gets tough to chew and sticky. These were fresh and delicious!  The pork came with peanut sauce and not the usual clear sweet sauce I'm accustomed to getting with pork. Was still good. I had the rare steak and flank pho and was really good. Broth was very tasty. There was lots of steak in the bowl.  Overall was a very good meal and will definitely be back
Amazing food, vegan pho was incredible. Great service, great food and cute location. Strongly recommend.

Good food, good service, great prices.  The apps were very fresh and tasty and the soups were quite nice.  My wife loved the duck, although the beef stew had some overly large chunks of gristle and the fake krab in the seafood soup was a little sketchy.  Overall: excellent for the price.

Food was good but not great. I got the shaking beef  for $12.99 which had 6 pieces of beef and the rest was onions with a big dash of black pepper. My aunt and uncle got pho but I can't say if it was good not. My aunt did say her seafood pho which consisted of imitation crab, shrimp and squid was just okay. My husband and uncle also got the Vietnamese coffee which came out already pre-made with loads of ice and that was just okay as well. The coffee was not served steeping with condense milk on the bottom as you would expect in a typical Vietnamese restaurant. Service was okay. I would not return.

This is our first time here. Richard was very friendly and funny. Most of us ordered pho and one ordered crispy egg. The broth was very good not too salty. They also were very nice when we  mistakenly ordered a spring roll when we wanted a crispy egg roll. Back home we call it spring roll. It's a very clean restaurant.  We'll be coming back.

Food is average, the server I got sucks as heck! He seems mad or having a bad day but greeting someone shouldn't even giving a tone like that .. and I don't think he knows food Handler safety also how he handle giving me the food I ordered .. 

Worst part is I ordered an ice coffee took about the same time other side that came last got theirs first .. sorry I do time whatever I get.. if I would've the other guy as a server I wouldn't be like this but oh well probly Im not coming back at all ..

We eat here a few times a month, it's across the street and everything in the menu is so good. There pork chop is bomb, there seafood pho is delicious and there egg wrap is amazing. The owner is the sweetest guy and takes great care of you

Pho-ntastic!  I found this place one day and just decided to try a new place, apparently it has been around for 3 years.  Just nevered ventured out this far before for pho.   It's quite a find!  I enjoyed the pho alot, the beef was tender and melted, the soup was flavorful and the oodles were cooked just right "al dente phoodles".   I'm a stickler on fresh Basil though and I know unlike California, basil isn't that fresh out here, so i'm not gonna pick on that.   The fresh spring rolls had really fresh leafy lettuce in it and tasted good.   I would definitely come back again.  The owner Eric was pretty honest and professional.  Shows in his restaurant.  Clean and well managed with good quality of food at reasonable value.

Let me just say this place has amazing customer service. They have the best spring rolls, Pad Thai, Garlic chicken wings, combination fried rice, and Bun Noodle bowls. Very inexpensive menu &  very clean restaurant.  They are closed on Tuesday and open at 11am during the week. I absolutely love this place and promise you will not be disappointed.
I came in very sick & weak (shoutout seasonal allergies). I wanted, no, I needed good Pho. The "P8" was my Virgil thru the depths of hell and I left with a cleansed soul.

I got to say on first expressions; easily accessible,  clean and fairly quiet. The staff was nice and respectable and got my family and I food and drink order fairly quickly. The pho soup, spring rolls and the pork rice meal we ordered was really enjoyable good. Only downside is I wish the broth of the soup was a little more hotter. Seemed a little colder than I liked. But overall, a enjoyable experience.

Really good.  I figured I would try it out since it had such a high rating and it was in the neighborhood.  I was impressed with the broth for the pho.  It had a distinct taste that was really yummy.  I will give you the small reasons I took one star away:  1.  They didn't tell me the wings were breaded before they brought them.  I eat gluten free for health reasons, so this was a bummer.  2.  They brought straw after straw for no apparent reason. (plastic hurts the ocean) That, and they use Styrofoam for their "to go" containers.  It's cheap and not good for the environment.  3.  The waiter seemed to need to be anywhere than with us.  He was a young waiter, but it's no excuse for good service.  4.  He didn't offer sweetener of any kind for my tea, and when he brought my tea refill, it was bitter like it had been sitting for too long.  5.  No pen with my check to sign the credit card slip.  Overall, the ambiance was pretty good.  It was open and airy and there were quite a few people there.  I would eat here again, but hope they improve on their environmental footprint.  Until then, I will be sure to tell them I don't want straws when I sit down and will bring my own "to go" containers, just in case.

As a first time visitor to this establishment, I was very impressed.  I brought my 3 children with me for a late night dinner.  We had rare beef pho, meatless pho, Asian chicken, and Vietnamese egg roll plus sodas.  We were seated immediately upon arriving and got to pick where we wanted to sit.  

Restaurant is very clean and the staff are friendly.  It was a little bit busy for a late night dinner, but just shows how popular this establishment is to the locals in Summerlin.  

All of our dishes came out hot and was warned by the waiter to be careful.  Food was truly delicious.  My kids are picky eaters, but they didn't come up for air until they were done.  

Their menu is extensive and it does include a kids menu.  Prices are reasonable and definitely saves me the trip of driving onto Spring Mountain Rd to eat some pho.  There are many pho restaurants in the valley, but this one is one of my top 3 favorites...best one in Summerlin no doubt. 

Recommendation...try it...you'll love it.

I was craving for Makarel and rice and my husband for Pho, saw Red Lantern Pho Vietnamese.  We are kinda hesitant to go there because of being new, we might not like it or something.  When I opened the door, the gentleman greeted us with a smile and let us eat right away. We ordered and the food came in less than 15 minutes which is a plus, the food is tasty with reasonable price.

This place is very good. The staff was extremely pleasant to deal with and even went above and beyond when we wanted to change our order. The soup was very flavorful, as was their meat. They have various dishes to choose from and are very helpful with substituting dishes! Overall, I highly recommend this place.

We came here because a friend wanted to check it out and I believe the owner has changed and therefore different name. Our table shared the shrimp spring roll and taking a pretty huge. They added lettuce on the edge to make it look better but I thought the presentation was pretty nice.

The pho broth is thick and fragrant and the noodles cooked perfectly. My husband thought it was pretty decent and that's saying a lot since he is such a picky eater. I ordered the vermicelli noodle mix and I got the grilled pork with the two eggroll. I would say they may need to work on it because the fish sauce ratio to the bowl was kinda low. I felt the dish was on the dry side and there was more veggie than normal (which is good but I wanted a noodles bowl not a salad..) 

When I come again I'm not sure because there's another pho (Vietnamese) places closer to me but if you're in the area its not a bad place to check out

Excellent!!
Fresh, authentic, great portion sizes, nice atmosphere, priced right and great service. 
This is what eating out is supposed to be like - good job!!

Stopped into this restaurant for lunch with my coworkers and had a fabulous time. Our sever was amazing and made some really good recommendations. Our food came our quickly and was super fresh. The chef even took my friends challenge to add even more spice to her already spicy meal! (She loved her dish, by the way.) 

It's an inexpensive place with great quality, and I definitely recommend it if you're in the area!

Great place, great service. The pho has a very flavorful broth. There are many options to put in the broth like choice of meat or veggies.  The summer rolls are the best deal in the southwest part of town. The store is super clean. Service is kind, funny, and quick. I've ordered take out and stayed to eat, it's always great.  The Thai tea is yummy too. Parking is convenient. Place is small but accommodating. The staff is helpful and usually makes me laugh. This is one of my favorite spots in the valley. It did just change its name to Red Lantern, but the service and food remained awesome. Family friendly, quick place with healthy options.
Lunch today! Delish...never disappointed! Pho beef rice noodles and egg rolls! Yaaasssss!

We leave this place always satisfied. The food is great, service is excellent and the restaurant is very clean. That's why we keep coming back. This is one of my family's favorite places to go for Vietnamese food.

They recently changed their name from Pho Annie 2 to Red Lantern and there are some minor updates in d√©cor.  Otherwise, everything seems the same.  The food is still delicious.  The service is still friendly.  I'm not sure if it's because we went on a busy Friday, but orders were getting mixed up.  I'm pretty sure we got the egg rolls from the table next to us, because our food came super fast and they ended up getting their egg rolls towards the end of their meal.  Also my combo pho states there's rare steak....it was all cooked.  I hope they sort everything out and ordering/receiving food becomes a little less chaotic.  We still thoroughly enjoy the fried egg rolls and the beef stew.  My husband tried a new item the egg wrapped fried rice. It was a huge amount of food and very tasty.  I probably would not order the pho again....I'll probably stick to my beef stew.  The pho was minimal in terms of meat and smaller bowl then a lot of the places in Chinatown.  We'll keep coming because it's one of the few decent pho restaurants near Summerlin.
This place is amazing. The curry chicken soup is so delicious, as well as the bun and pho. We also always begin with spring rolls. The owner is super friendly the service is always stellar.

My husband and I are here for the first time.  Don't let the exterior, fast food appearance fool you. You are in for a great casual dining experience.
We ordered the spring rolls which had a beautiful presentation. The rolls were very fresh and tasted fantastic. I ordered the chicken Pho. The broth was the best ever, very flavorful. The soup had plenty of big chunks of chicken. The Thai basil and bean sprouts that were served with it were fresh and aromatic.
The service was excellent and the restaurant was very clean. We will definitely be coming back and we will bring friends. If you have not tried this type of food before you will want to eat here.
Now our go to Pho place and they have pho Sate.  Have not had a bad meal yet and they sell pho borth to go.
It's the old Annie Pho 2.  Same owners and everything.  The food and service here is great!

Once you enter this place you can smell the amazing food that awaits. Our server was prompt and friendly. Food was delicious. I wish they were closer so I could visit more often but will definitely make a special trip to come eat here again.

This review is just for a take out order.  The pho was still hot when it got home.  Received the extra limes and side of onions I requested.  The pho was delicious and fulfilling.   Next time I crave pho or vietnamese food I will dine inside and check it out more.

The best place to go to if you're craving pho. Especially when you're hungover. Customer service is great.
Eric, Richard and Jayson always make me feel like I am
VIP. They know I'm a regular. I recommend the spring
Rolls and rare steak pho.

This restaurant used to be Annie Pho 2 but apparently they recently changed their named. They always have wonderful customer service. There was a little issue with our food but it was taken care of the right way. 

We ordered short ribs and two pork chop & egg rolls vermicelli. Our usuals at Vietnamese restaurants.

I have never been to a place that serves Pho that is as clean as this and has amazing service.  We wandered in one night because it is located close to where we recently moved.  We did not expect much but as soon as we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised.  There are not many other places I will go for my Pho fix now.  Highly recommend this gem.

I have 0 complaints about this place. 

The food is so good and they have such a great variety of veggie options. Service is awesome. The owner stops by all the time and it's one of those places where you feel like they genuinely care that you have a good experience. 

Inside is super clean and spacious. Used to go when it was Pho Annie's and now love it just the same. Perfect as the weather starts to cool off. 

Andddd the prices are so reasonable. An order of veggie potstickers are 5.99 and comes with 10! You just can't beat that.
This is my family's go to place for Pho. Friendly and accommodating staff! Great service! Great food!

This place is great. The food is excellent and the service is just as good. It's no surprise that my family and I frequent this restaurant and will continue doing so.

We've been getting Pho from all of the bug named restaurants in Vegas for years and Red Lantern meets or exceeds all of them.

Pro tip: get extra noodles! It's just a buck or two and, if you're like me, you'll appreciate the extra noodles o go with the delicious broth!

I found this place looking for the nearest pho in the area. And I'm so happy I did! We've eaten here many times. I've taken my family here for dinner or ate here not feeling well, and We always leave happy and satisfied. (Serious hangover or cold cure!)
Service: always friendly and attentive.  I know they know their customers, not just us. And it's a great thing to notice. 
Food: we are vegetarian/ pescatarian. And I just love the veggie pho or the seafood pho with veggie broth. The bowls are a great size for a great price! We also love the crab ragoons, fresh spring roll, and veggie gyoza. 
Thank you red lantern pho for everything.

We come to Red Lantern every Friday for what we like to call Ph√≥ Phriday! Richard and Eric have the best customer service. It's nice to find a local spot that has amazing food and service, definitely keeps us coming back!

Recent rebranding, same amazing ownership, front office, and cooking talent. Just stopped by for the usual pho dac biet and egg rolls. Broth was super clean and deep umami, meat super fresh, noodles al dente, egg rolls fresh out of the frier and with dat fish sauce + lettuce + jalape√±o slices though... I just ate and now I've made myself hungry again.

It's the people that make this pho shop so special... you've simply have to give them a chance. Come hungry, I always do!

Very nice service. Food is good and shorter drive than to
Spring Mtn. 

Will definitely be back.
Definitely the best place for Pho in Las Vegas. Richard, Eric, and Jayson are friendly and great with customer service. I go here weekly and highly recommend it. The spring rolls are awesome too!

It was a cold day and this place is not too far from my girlfriend's home in Blue Diamond.  Lots of windows and the tile floor remained a little slippery on a winter day.  So many windows and it just added to the dampness inside.  Mainly Caucasians working which was different but cool  My pho wasn't huge like i am used to.  It was almost luke warm and lots of noodle with little meat.  Price was fair and service was okay.  I asked my girlfriend about her pho and she said the same.  I would consider to come here just because of the close  vicinity to my girlfriend.

My husband just ordered takeout and the order is completely wrong. He didn't want to wait for it to be fixed since it's raining, so he just took the food. There was no discount offered or anything. I can't even call to ask for the name of the guy who took the order because either no one picks up or they hung up.

Am so excited that I found a new go to Vietnamese place near me. The lines at pho Kim long and the location was just too way out of the way. The one dish that is always a big game changer for us is the Pork Chop. 

So I have to say the boneless pork was amazing, on top of it I love how it came with 2 eggs. The flavor was perfect, not too sweet, not too bland, just perfect! 

I also tried the Pho with rare steak and meatball, that was delicious as well! Ingredients were fresh and soup was tasty. 

I tried the fried egg rolls as well, this one was ok, although not as good as my mom's.

The Thai iced tea was really good as well!

So in summary, good food, clean place, nice and peaceful ambience, also there are a few large tables in the back that can accommodate larger parties even if the place is not that big, very decent prices - $10 and under, great service! This a 5 star in my book, am definitely coming back!

We were trying to find a new Pho place because the one near us closed downs SO GLAD we found this place! Super yummy, super fast service, super friendly staff! They gained a customer out of myself and my husband!
